title: Toronto Blue Jays all-time home run leaders 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Players in the x axis and Number of home runs in the y axis.
The maximum Number of home runs 336.0 is found at Players Carlos Delgado and the minimum is found at Ernie Whitt where Players is 131.0.
There is a difference of 205.0 between the maximum Players Carlos Delgado and minimum Players Ernie Whitt.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Players in the x axis and Number of home runs in the y axis.
The Number of home runs is appeared to be the highest at Players Carlos Delgado and lowest at Players Ernie Whitt.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Players in the x axis and Number of home runs in the y axis.
The maximum Number of home runs 336.0 is found at Players Carlos Delgado and the minimum is found at Ernie Whitt where Players is 131.0.
There is a difference of 205.0 between the maximum Players Carlos Delgado and minimum Players Ernie Whitt.
max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Players, and Number of home runs in each Players on the y axis.
The maximum Number of home runs 336.0 is found at Players Carlos Delgado and the minimum is found at Ernie Whitt where Players is 131.0.
Second maximum Number of home runs is found at Players Jose Bautista.
The difference of Number of home runs between the highest and lowest Players is 205.0.
Number of home runs at Players Carlos Delgado is 336.0 , second place is Jose Bautista at 288.0, and thirdly is Edwin Encarnacion at 239.0.
The highest value 336.0 at Carlos Delgado is almost 1.6 times larger than the average value 209.6.
The Number of home runs is 2096.0 if we add up values of all Playerss.
